meanings.definition: A person who is devoted to the pursuit of wealth and material possessions.
meanings.sent1: The mammonist spent all his time chasing money and expensive things.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a mammonist because she valued money above all else.
meanings.sent3: The mammonist joked that their idea of a perfect vacation was counting money on a tropical island.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, he was a mammonist, always seeking to increase his wealth.
meanings.sent5: The mammonist's house was filled with luxurious items, showcasing their love for wealth.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the pursuit of wealth and material possessions.
meanings.sent1: The mammonist lifestyle was evident in her extravagant purchases.
meanings.sent2: He had an unmistakable mammonist attitude, always flaunting his wealth.
meanings.sent3: The mammonist decor of the office included gold-plated furniture and diamond-encrusted pens.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with a mammonist gleam when she saw the designer handbag on sale.
meanings.sent5: The mammonist culture glorified materialism and opulence above all else.
